data.title: How to fill gap between 2 polygons using jts functions?
data.meta_description: I have 2 polygons that are supposed to be exactly adjacent to each other but sometimes they form a gap/overlap in between. For e.g. in the below image there is a small gap on one side and a small o...
data.text:
I do not believe that know if JTS supports filling the gaps directly. OpenJUMP that is a Java GIS program based on JTS has a special tool for that task. The tool is included in the OpenJUMP Plus version and it can be found from Plugins - Topology - Coverage cleaner.

The source code is within the topology extension code https://github.com/openjump-gis/topology-extension/blob/main/src/main/java/fr/michaelm/jump/plugin/topology/TopologyExtension.java. This may be the exact place https://github.com/openjump-gis/topology-extension/blob/a365a36c3db43200a0c6b8e34a50255e0df33c7d/src/main/java/com/vividsolutions/jcs/plugin/clean/CoverageCleanerPlugIn.java.
